page.title: 04PEASLAKE SCHOOL
page.content:
Peaslake Church of England School.
At first lessons were held in the Old School Room in the centre of the village. Records date from l876. A new school was built in l9l3 on Colman's Hill. Children attended from age 5 to l4. Another classroom was added in l929. After the l944 Education Act children after age ll went to secondary schools outside the village. Another reorganisation in l973 changed the school to a First School for children aged 5 to 8. The building is much the same but has been well adapted and given modern electrical wiring and internal plumb- ing. The site is beautiful. The school is surrounded by gardens, trees and playing fields. There are about fifty children and three teachers.
